name: ROYAL VICTORIAN AERO CLUB.
about: The Royal Victorian Aero Club (RVAC), founded in 1914, is one of Australia's oldest and most esteemed flying training organizations. Originally located at Point Cook, the club has a rich history rooted in military aviation, with its members playing crucial roles in World War I. Now based at Moorabbin Airport, RVAC offers professional and accredited flight training, including the Diploma of Aviation (Commercial Pilot Licence - Aeroplane) and Diploma of Aviation (Instrument Rating). As a Registered Training Organisation, RVAC is compliant with all CASA standards and prioritizes safety above all. The club is a not-for-profit organization, reinvesting profits into improving facilities, aircraft, and member benefits. With a diverse membership ranging from 16 to 80 years old, RVAC fosters a vibrant social environment and a supportive learning community, making it an ideal place for aspiring pilots to embark on their aviation journey.
